website_summaries.verdict: The best insoles for men’s work boots that also reduce tiredness on the job.
pros: Reduces (even eliminates) back pain and leg fatigue for those who work all day on hard or concrete floors
Multiple sizes to choose from for men (XS - XXL)
Ideal for work boots and steel-toe boots
Work just as well, if not better than expensive insoles at half the price
Hold up six months to a year
Zero complaints in the comfort department
cons: Not recommended for sports shoes or sneakers

customer_reviews.title: My personal favorite insole
customer_reviews.text: great, supportive insole. for those curious about the size difference between a L and XL, see the photos below. the insole on the left is the Large, XL on the right. the XL is roughly .5" wider and longer than the L at maximum.
customer_reviews.author: Val Salva

customer_reviews.title: Beats up Dr. Scholl's, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: We always replace worn foot beds of our work boots with more comfortable soles, and have tried most. The Timberland boot inserts have been fantastic in our Timberland work boots! Maybe because they are made specifically for Timberlands'? Anywho we DO recommend; BUT... pulled a star due to price, and the fact that Timberland should have installed these already in their steel toe work boots considering the price of the boots, the fact that they manufacturer both, & steel toes are obviously work boots, not a fashion accessory, and people will be standing, and working in them for hours a day - every day. Thinking about it now, and I should take 2 stars! Lol! Anywho give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: TheBowdensTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Top fabric now seperates from foam
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these insoles several times over the years, the last pair I just received, after 1 use, the fabric was pealing from the foam, causing it to bunch up in the shoe, I pealed the fabric the rest of the way off, the glue was barely adhering the fabric to the foam. These are still very comfortable insoles, however, the fabric acts as an anti-friction, with only the foam, the insole wants to pull from my boots when taking them off. I have emailed timberland directly, that was several days ago and no response. I just wanted them to be aware of the quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: drjoeshmoe

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade your Alpinestars
customer_reviews.text: The paper-thin stock insoles Alpinestars used to equip the older Tech III MX and Newland boots with made them like walking on cardboard. How Revzilla and all those guys rave about them being in their words "extremely comfortable" is beyond me, since it's obvious they're talking about stock. The difference is like night and day. These made even my giant Tech IIIs comfortable enough that I can work entire 8-10 hour shifts in them without my feet screaming! Do your feet a favour and upgrade your tired or subpar boot insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Best footbeds I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: I am hard on my feet. I hunt the backcountry mountains of colorado and hike at least a hundred miles a season, so i rely on my feet and demand comfort. For years i bought much more expensive footbeds/insoles, but have never been completely satisfied. Last year i decided to try these and i can honestly say these are the best yet. I recently bought another pair for my everyday shoes, they are amazing. So comfortable and cushy. I highly recommend these, you will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a fan
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of women's Earth Keeper winter Timberland boots that came with awesome, comfy insoles, and I wanted to get more of the same insoles for my other shoes. These looked just like them so I ordered them, but they were not the same great insole I was hoping for. They were way too thick, heavy, and not soft as the ones I love. Waste of $20. Too thick to even fit in any of my boots. Do yourself a favor and stick to Dr. Scholl's memory foam insoles instead of these.
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The fabric peeled off after my first walk in them.
customer_reviews.text: Both at the heel and the toe, the fabric straight up peeled right off. I tried using spray adhesive to stick it back down as I really needed my boots, but it hasn't held, either. I have a pair of shoes that came with these from the factory, and they're holding up fine, so I don't know what the problem is, but I won't be buying these trimmable replacements again.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Not for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and these are extremely uncomfortable. Been wearing them for a week in my combat boots and they're kiling me. I can't return them because I had to trim them significantly to fit in my boot. I wear a size 12 and ordered the 12-13 and it was almost 2 inches too long.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyJ

customer_reviews.title: The worst insole I've ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: My old boots were Timberland Pros with the anti fatigue soles and they were the most comfortable boots I've ever owned. After my employer bought me new boots, I decided to get these insoles to try and get back some of the comfort I was used to. That"s not what happened though, because these are a nightmare. These take up so much extra room in my shoes it's not even funny. They make my slip-on boots unwearable and my lace-ips have to be let out significantly. I honestly think you would need to go up a size and width for these to fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: McWelder

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I do not work in a wet environment, my job is industry maintenance, dry warehouse, 12 hour shifts. I purchased 2 pair of these insoles. First pair took approximately 3 days for my lower back to start hurting, and six days for them to start coming apart. What I mean by coming apart is the layers began separating, and bunching up under my feet. I thought, maybe I got a bad pair, so I grabbed the second pair and installed them. 3 days, and they began to separate also, and the back pain just kept getting worse. Switched to a Dr. Scholl's insert, I'll never purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shock Absorption and Quick Drying
customer_reviews.text: First thing this is completely a insole replacement. As in your shoes must have a removable insole to replace. This is not designed to sit atop of an existing removable insole or a non-removable insole unfortunately. This thing is well made and very thick. Insoles only worked when existing insole was removed. That’s the intended purpose so I was okay with that. That being said they’re extremely comfortable and dry rather quickly. For being so thick the insoles dry very fast. Excellent heel cup design. Shock and impact absorbing. When I walk I strike down my heel rather hard and the insoles handle it no problem. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I had to use scissors to trim to fit to go inside my $300 redwing workboots. OMG. Transformed the boots. They are literally like running shoes now. 2-3 weeks later I still look down and admire how comfortable they are. The boots barely had any support and all and had no removable insole--for 2-3 years. I used neatsfoot oil and it actually made them a little stretched and sloppy (space-wise). Enter these big in-soles--they filled the void with a comfortable layer underfoot. There is no way I could put these in most of my shoes (my snug Justin boots)--no room. But for these particular RedWings it was a big win.
customer_reviews.author: jwd

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Left one is great, quick trim threw it in no problems. The right one is defective no matter how much I trimmed or glued after about an hour it would be working it's way up the side of my boot (my boots are fairly snug) thought the boot was the issue put it in 3 different footwear's same thing happened every time. It's not very fun walking on your ankle... Very unhappy I tossed away my money
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As Reviews Say
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these; I saw an overwhelming amount of positive reviews for them. They're definitely not any better than Dr. Scholls, like whatsoever, specially for the price. If you see the pictures, you see indents where I wore them for one day of work, of 13 hours. While other insoles have lasted MONTHS in comparison. They don't have much support whatsoever, and are rather thin. Not to he used for lengthy periods of standing. 20 some odd dollars for something that already had indents after one day of use? Absolutely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anxious dog

customer_reviews.title: Great for tired feet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband. He is on his feet all day and wears steal toe boots. I had always purchased the Spenco insoles but decided to try something different when he started to complain about his legs hurting. These were much less expensive than Spenco and work much better. We had to trim to fit, like you have to do with most insoles. He immediately noticed a difference in his feet not hurting as much and the tiredness in legs is gone. He has worn them for a few weeks now and they have continued to work as well as they did on day one.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Forman

customer_reviews.title: Great Insoles
customer_reviews.text: I work on my feet all day wearing Redwing steel toe boots. Understandably, insoles wear out fast. I have tried expensive RW insoles and also the popular gel brands. All work well at first but do not last more than a few weeks. These Timberland insoles are comfortable and last a reasonable amount of time. I do; however, change out insoles about every four months. A small price to pay to avoid foot pain after a long day. I highly recommend this product for someone who hasn’t found the right recipe to avoid foot pain due to long hours standing up.
customer_reviews.author: J.F.

customer_reviews.title: Not for a hard day work...
customer_reviews.text: Most likely Timberland are not working shoes they are fancy shoes. The anti-fatigue soles work for just few time but no when you have to be on your feet all day long, not even talk about claiming ladder or scalffolds. Bottom line, this is for a Friday night at the club to look good with your timberland boots and rest your feet from waiting in line or at the bar...
customer_reviews.author: Erick Acuna

customer_reviews.title: Low quality material, not breathable, and bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I cut these to fit into my steel toe red wings boots.. More comfortable than the originals, but not very breathable or sturdy, these started to fall apart after one week of use for 12hrs/day for 7 days straight. I experienced lower back pain during that first week but it got better. After two weeks of 12hrs/day 7 days a week I noticed they have really worn down, make my feet hot and are extremely bulky. I wouldn’t order these again, I will probably buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Five days and they're already falling apart...
customer_reviews.text: I received these insoles on Saturday and now, five days later the top covering, which is supposedly some miracle temperature/odor-controlling miracle material is already peeling away. Now, I will be the first to say that these are, hands-down, the most comfortable insoles I've ever owned but, c'mon Timberland! With all of your money and R&D you guys couldn't find a suitable adhesive that would keep the material in place for longer than a few days?
customer_reviews.author: R. B. E.

customer_reviews.title: Makes Thorogood moc toes feel like a mattress
customer_reviews.text: You have to trim these. They are for work boots. If you do skilled labor and cannot trim these perfectly PLEASE fire yourself and exit skilled trades! If you do not think these are absolutely amazing you are probably to lightweight to compress the amazing material. I put these in Thorogood steel toe mocs, absolutely amazing now. End of story. Buying 5 more to keep on ice.
customer_reviews.author: rwr

customer_reviews.title: So far Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my husband a new pair of boots and these well the insoles came before the boots. My husband put these insoles into his old boots I asked how they felt in them old boots. He said the felt good his feet did not hurt like they normally do. I had to purchase another pair for his new boots. My husband has been a welder for over 30 years and he never worried about his feet or shoes/boots. Now he knows when insole make a difference our Doctor told him his soles were worn out and that is why he is in pain all the time. So I PRAY these insole do the job!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee S.

customer_reviews.title: Great inner soles, but mine had a problem.
customer_reviews.text: These inner soles are great. They are a little thicker than the original ones. They help a ton of you are on pavement all day. You trim them to fit your boots so sizing is fine. The problem I have is after the first week the black felt on top peeled up all the way to the arch of my foot. So I try to lay it down when putting my foot in my boot but it instantly balls up becoming uncomfortable. The blue foam padding layer under the black felt just crumbles and makes an uneven surface. I would buy again but I was really hoping for these to last longer than a week.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: The only insole I use in my work boots.
customer_reviews.text: Being flat footed and walking on my heels my feet are really tired after work, a relative recommended the insole for my work boots at first I was skeptical mainly because every company advertises "antifatigue" but after using them for 2 years in my Redbacks, Justin's, Husky etc.. I'll say they actually work. Not saying you dont get tired at all but comparing original or other brand insoles these definately cut down drastically on fatigue. Now everytime I purchase a pair of work boots I immediately order a pair of these. Again for someone who is flat footed and predominantly walks on their heels definately recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Manriquez

customer_reviews.title: Unusable on boots that fit.
customer_reviews.text: Unusable on boots that fit and may not be useable in boots too large. I cannot get my foot comfortably into my boots with the insoles in place. My foot is squeezed by the tongue and my heel sits to high in the boot. Cannot use. Waste of money. Too bad. If they fit, they seem like they actually make walking more comfortable. I'll never find out, though.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: BIG DIFFERENCE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these almost a year ago now and slid them into my Timberland Pro PitBoss 6" Steel toe boots to try and add another layer of comfort to my feet. I work in a very busy and physically demanding manufacturing facility and am constantly on my feet (between 9-12hrs per day, 5 days a week). These insoles have softened the blow that come from concrete floors for the amount of time I spend on my feet. Definitely notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: OhWerd

customer_reviews.title: Love them! 1 problem..
customer_reviews.text: Cut to fit well in my shoes. These added a HUGE amount of comfort on the already comfortable Rockport Walker Catalyst shoes i have. I work in manufacturing and am running around on concrete floors all day. I had pretty bad back problems but its reduced significantly with thay combination. Only one complaint, the top layer tjat yoir feet come in contact with, is thin and comes apart almost immediately. Im going to use 3m spray adhesive and try to get it to stay. If it comes off, its a weird absorbent foam under that i dont want my feet directly on.
customer_reviews.author: japa

customer_reviews.title: Soft but no support for the Arch
customer_reviews.text: I like these for their thickness and tried them out for 3 weeks. They made my foot feel tight bc they take up alot of space in my REDWING WORKBOOTS and so I had to loosen the laces out... They do offer soft padding but my feet tired much sooner than the original padding because they have no arch support. It is too soft and made of the exact same sponge material so it flattens when you have your foot in shoe. These would be the best in the market if they only placed a arch support inside the padding.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: One year review, very comfortable but only last a year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several pairs of these, they are without a doubt the most comfortable insoles I have used. I am retired and mainly work on motorcycles in my garage and take care of our property. The only complaint and reason for the 3 star review is they only lasted a year before the padded foam rolls up and comes loose from the main insole rendering them "uncomfortable" If you don't mind replacing them every year than they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Your gonna need to cut it.
customer_reviews.text: You will most likely need to cut it, I cut mine out for a pair of hiking shoes and so far they make a wondrous replacement. I ordered a couple more because some of my boots hurt after 10 hours of wearing them and I feel like these would make a huge difference. The cutting part is pretty simple, only took about 5 mins. I used an older sole on top so that I could easily make the an exact copy. I would definitely recommend you get this if you are on your feet 8 or more hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Masum M.

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT last a single shift!
customer_reviews.text: I'm rewriting my review as Amazon Rejected my previous one for some unknown reason... As previously stated, received them on Monday afternoon placed them inside my boots and used them for the first time Tuesday morning. By lunch time 5 hours in I felt something inside my boot.. I removed my boot and found the top layer of the insoles had already peeled off, 5 hours into my shift as an active law enforcement officer.. I would not recommend these insoles as it currently sits, unknown if I received a defective pair. Attached are photos of the bottom of the insoles showing the new condition and a photo of the top after only 5 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: KNR

customer_reviews.title: Go great with RedWing 2233s.
customer_reviews.text: Awsome for being on your feet on reinforced concrete all day! I’ve replaced my main work boots insoles (Red Wing) with these. I get about 6 months per pair out of them. They fit inside of a pair 9.5D RedWing 2233s out of the package without trimming. For the money, they’re pretty awesome. The Only other insoles besides these I will use are RedWing Comfort Force in my Heritage 875 Moc-Toe boots. These are almost as good, and half the price! So you can’t go wrong for the price if you own good leather boots and are on your feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 66 hours a week mostly 12 hour days
customer_reviews.text: Love the amount of support provided by these soles. I work 66 hours a week mostly 12 hour days. I’m on my feet all day long on hard steel and hard/uneven concrete. I’m on my third or fourth set. I knew I needed a new pair for a while now. When I finally repurchased I noticed a major difference. They do wear out and I would recommend replacing them roughly after a year or so depending on how much you use them. If you are at the threshold of one of the various sizes go ahead an opt for the next size up considering they have to be trimmed down anyway. Hope this review helps!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly in my size 10 Timb. Pros
customer_reviews.text: The large size of these fits perfectly in my size 10 Timberland pro Steel toe boots. It's a very tight fit, and they do wrap verrry slightly up the sides of the shoe, but that actually has added to the comfort of my boots. They are intended to be cut to the size of your original insoles of the boot but I didn't even measure mine - just took the old ones out and put the new ones in. Comfy as heck.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable insole I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy the best footwear I can find; shoes/boots, socks, insoles. I'm 80 have lots of hard miles on my feet and a little arthritis. The best insole I have found was in a pair of Clark slippers so I put them in my boots and started looking for an insole like them. The Timberland is very close to the same construction but just a touch better at giving me more positive balance. Also it is just as comfortable. I've already ordered two more pairs
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Broe

customer_reviews.title: Low profile and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the ones to buy. I just bought a brand new pair of Red Wing boots #4436. Great boots, however the original insole was less than desirable. Also important to mention, is that these boots have an internal metguard, which is protection for the top of the foot. These Timberland Pro insoles are great because they provide excellent comfort while maintaining a lower profile. Some insoles are too thick, which tends to raise the foot within the boot smashing is against the metguard inside. Super easy to trim, I used the original Red Wing insoles as a template and trimmed around with a pair of scissors. After only one day I can tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Buy a whole size down. These are huge. I ended up cutting mine to make them fit and they still didn't work out for me. They are so thick. I ended up just throwing them away because obviously I can't return something I cut into. I would look somewhere else. These are way too expensive for what you get. I was putting mine in non-Timberland boots so maybe it's my fault for trying to use them in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the factory inoles put these in!!
customer_reviews.text: I work all day in a factory, standing and walking I probably tried over 20 insoles, these are by far the best I used, every body has there own style and likes.. but I bought the keen Atlanta cool wide steel toes.. there insoles suck, but loved the wide shoe and steel toe area lots of room. So I bought the timberland insoles. I love how wide they are not to much arch either , you may have to trim a little.. but well worth it because they are wide enough I can put my Dr sholles 3/4 custom fit orthotic right on top of it and still have lots of room everywere!! For me that what works..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and quality.  Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband. Construction worker on concrete all day. These are one of the best insoles you can buy for less than $40. The last pair lasted him a year. They were actually still comfortable but I got him new boots so a new pair of these as well. Very durable. Dont fall flat like many of the other insoles. Note- He wears a size 13 and I buy the 12-13 size and we have to trim them a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t hold up for 2 weeks. Shoddy and Uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I’m in construction and ordered these for my work boots. In less than a week the insoles began delaminating and top liner came off. 2 weeks in the foam began degrading in the heel and high pressure areas and little shreds of blue foam would come out on my socks, and man oh man did they leave my feet sore!!! I got suckered in by the reviews and attractive price, and I went right back to my normal foot beds. Learn from my fail. Skip these and stick with Power Steps.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a knockoff but works
customer_reviews.text: I feel like these are not actual timberland pro inserts. Maybe I'm wrong but the seem like a knock off. The ones that can I'm my timberland boondocks were much thicker especially at the toes and different shaped at the toes. I was able to trace my old Insoles and cut the new ones. Over all they work but if you are looking for the true anti fatigue look else where
customer_reviews.author: Wade Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for flat-footed person
customer_reviews.text: I work in a warehouse and am on my feet for 8-9hrs. I have flat feet. The soreness trade off is that these get me through the work day but then my feet are sore at home. But if use a high-arch insoles, my feet hurt at work and then they're ok at home. I'd rather be comfortable at work. **tip, when you get home, lay on your back on the floor or bed close the wall and put your feet/legs up. Allow gravity to take the blood from your legs/feet away and rest. This usually helps
customer_reviews.author: dexter p.

customer_reviews.title: Rejuvenate your old shoes and pamper your feet with this!
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat large but still fits my boots without much problem. It will probably take a couple of wear time for it to settle but one thing for sure, I now love my work boots! The comfort and support level it provides is astonishing, it's like wearing a completely different boots. Better overall comfort so I'm happy. I might have to purchase more for my other shoes, and that is certainly cheaper than having to buy new shoes if my old ones are still serviceable. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MonTex

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these you replace the insoles for my timberland anti-fatigue boots. These are a direct replacement for the ones that came with the boots originally. I was very happy with these at first, but after five days- the top cloth layer came off of both soles. The padding is still good, but now they have an uncomfortable gritty feeling on my feet. I used the original soles for almost a year, and this never happened to them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Luszcz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome insoles.
customer_reviews.text: These are cut to fit. Take your old insole out and place the old insole over these and trace it with a sharpie around the edges. Proceed to cut around the lines, toss out the old insoles and install these and walk right on into heaven. These came with my Timberland ProTM️ Boots I had for 10 years and I put these into my CarolinasTM️ And recommend them if your on your feet for 8+ hrs a day.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Almost junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a "trim-to-fit" product. But when you trim, you release the topmost fabric footbed layer from the glue on the rubber compound material beneath. Within minutes of placing this in my shoes and wearing them, the fabric layer had pulled away from the main layer and bunched up under my toes. I can now only use this product if wearing socks, which themselves stick to the now-exposed rubber layer. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: AzIrish

customer_reviews.title: Just bad.
customer_reviews.text: They were falling apart after day one. Not comfortable at all, and basically no difference from a normal shoe sole. Don’t listen to all these fake 5 star reviews, the things are garbage. The heels were smooshed flat by the end of my shift, a hole forming and the cloth on top already fell off. So now they just feel weird in my boot. If you work an actual labor job, don’t get these. I don’t know what a better option would be, but anything is better than these.
customer_reviews.author: James Hewitt II

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable but only lasted a couple of months. I will not buy these again
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Much needed Timberland Pro boot insert.
customer_reviews.text: Like the added support for both heel and arch. Last longer than the factory Timberland work boot insoles which heel compress quickly causing severe discomfort and pain. These last around 8-10 months if you do a lot of walking/standing on concrete. Will prolong life of your boots by changing these out soon as worn out slightly. Dislike having to cut with scissors, make sure they are good and sharp/new or you'll struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Just one issue...
customer_reviews.text: It was too big at first, but you're supposed to cut it down to fit, and it fit perfectly once I did, but the black cover layer came off of one of them, and now it causes a lot of friction against my foot when I walk. The first day I got a few blisters from this, so now I have to wear double socks, but that fixed the friction problem. My shoes are comfy again, and I love the feel over all, I just have to do more sock laundry. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Moneypennie

customer_reviews.title: Makes any boot better!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace the stiff, no padding or support insole that came in my Merrell work boot. I hated the boot because of the insole that was a very stiff hard foam......once I put these insoles in I enjoyed wearing the boots again. The Merrell boots are very stiff and ridgid and not as good as my T-Pro Boondocks that I love as the absorbsion of soul is much better in Timberlands. That said Timberlands Insole can make any boot better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the best insoles that I have used for work boots
customer_reviews.text: These are the best insoles that I have used for work boots. With these insoles I find that foot and knee pain and fatigue are greatly reduced. One word for to get the most out your insoles. Read the directions and wash these insoles. I thought that I needed to buy new ones, until I washed them. Brought them back to life to live on. So far I have been using the 3 pairs (I rotate them daily) for 8 months and they are still going strong. I do not think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all Trades

customer_reviews.title: Take up too much space in shoe
customer_reviews.text: You really need to have an oversize shoe to wear these. They take up a lot of real estate on the bottom of your shoe. After wearing for about an hour I had to remove as my circulation was being effected. I can't really say they work a whole lot better than standard Dr. Scholl gel inserts. The nice thing with the Dr. Scholl's is they are heal supports and that's really where the impact of hard floors comes from. So, not for me. I'm just going to go back to the standard gel foam inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave 1 star is due to size. It stated 9-10 shoe size you would need a large, but they were way way too long for his size. I'm not even sure a Med. would work for 9-10 that's how much of a difference there was. I've heard these were great insoles, so this rating has nothing to do with how they feel, just the size. Buyer beware, make sure you get smaller ones if you order. I ended up losing money, too much trouble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Almost there, heel is good, rest is not.
customer_reviews.text: Timberland pro boots with these inserts from the factory have been some of the most comfy boots I've ever worn, HOWEVER, These inserts(in red wing boots) do not come close. The heel cushion is fine and offers more cushion than the factory insert but the front of Insert, is just too thin. The balls of the foot just below the toes still hurt from walking. If they could just make the front pad a little thicker it would get a higher rating. Red wings are over priced , I'll just go back to timberland pro boots as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: These insoles while not cheap are durable and comfortable on my feet. Everyone has different needs for foot comfort, but this insole has my boots wearing like tennis shoes. I work on hard steel surfaces and these help absorb the wear that leads to foot fatigue. Easily a 5 star product due to quality and comfort exceeding my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: actually helped
customer_reviews.text: I put these in my CAT steel toe workboots, I have been having a lot of pain at work (standing on steel for around 12-14 hours a day) so I finally caved and got some insoles, These actually relieved a ton of pressure and the shooting pains I was experiencing have went away. I notice a difference when I get home and can actually walk normally! Just wanted to share this with anyone considering these. Also I did have to trim the insoles some to fit my 10 1/2 boot, it might be a perfect fit for an 11 but might have to trim a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment!!
customer_reviews.text: You have to cut down the insoles. but that’s not the problem. The insoles I HD bought from Walmart until I got these were more comfortable and less than half the price. Not sure why they’re so uncomfortable after I’ve had so many coworkers brag about the pros. When people told me i’d Spend hundreds of dollars looking for the right insoles I didn’t believe them but now I do. Maybe tailored ones would be best bet.
customer_reviews.author: Sa'eed

customer_reviews.title: are extremely comfortable, unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: These can be cut to fit, they come ready for wide sized boots, are extremely comfortable, unfortunately, the slick top surface is not very durable, so just recover them with rayon from your local material shop and the foam will last years of your under 200 lbs. The other serving suggestion would be Georgia boots version of these, they are slightly thicker, more durable, but their color shows more dirt than usual, as do these after several months of wear without daily cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Teacherman

customer_reviews.title: Not for Danner Acadias
customer_reviews.text: Material unnecessarily thick in the toe area. Had to trim quite a bit. Also, there aren’t any liner in a Danner Acadia boot to remove and follow a pattern to fit. So trimming and trying on multiple times was arduous. These Danners are a half size larger than I normally wear so using other liners wouldn’t work. After all that trimming still way too tight in the toes. Went w Spenco liners and the 12.5 fit the Danner 11.5 PERFECT. No trimming.
customer_reviews.author: A A

customer_reviews.title: Ok product, but the black top layer peeled off after a month for me
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok product. I wouldn't say the cushioning is out of this world, but ok. For me, probably because I run and am active so much. The top layer of the insoles(the black part, with the the logo), started peeling off within a month, and completely peeled off. Right now, the top layer of the insoles are light blue, and I'm still using it, because I don't have another insole. Right now with the blue part being the top layer, the insoles are not as good, it's really bad, it doesn't even feel that good.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: After trimming it to the old insole it felt slightly better than the Dr. Scholls work insole i brought from Wal-Mart so it was better than the original insole however I dropped one star because the black lining on top of the insole came loose by the toes on one side and bunched up making it very uncomfortable so i had to rip it off leaving the blue foam underneath that through my sock feel slightly rough but causes no discomfort only a difference of feeling between the two sides. So all in all a great product and would recommend some stronger adhesive on the black fabric liner so this doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: KELSEY

customer_reviews.title: They dont last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the insoles on my timberland boots. I have a bad back so everything about my shoes is important. I was excited to get these. They worked great at first. After about 4 weeks my feet were hurting by the end of the day. I work 10 hours a day and most of it is sitting! So thats pretty bad. Going back to my other brand at least I know they will last longer. Only walking or standing an hour or 2 a day is not much they should of lasted longer. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Very beefy and strong construction-
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews b4 deciding on these for construction worker husbands boots. I ordered larger than his size so he could cut off some of thin toes and would b a bit thicker, as people complained about too thin in toes. My plan worked as expected 👍🏼 The positive descriptions of material and quality are accurate. Dont know how long will last but are these things supposed to not need periodic replacing?? (that rhetorical-lol!)
customer_reviews.author: Suburban Wife & Mom

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet a lot. I needed some type of cushioning for my shoes. These work very well. I was so impressed, I bought a second set for other shoes I wear. I am very pleased and I highly recommend these to all who are on their feet a great deal and need the comfort of good cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect insole
customer_reviews.text: there wasn't anything that I didn't like. This insert saved my feet. I suffer occasionally from plantar fascitis (sp?). Since I put these inserts in my workboots, I can stand on concrete floors all day. Highly recommend. Wish I could use in my dress shoes. but I might have to go up a size. Next pair of shoes are going to be fitted with these inserts in them.
customer_reviews.author: Helen L

customer_reviews.title: BEST INSOLE PERIOD. MADE FOR MEN WHO WORK.
customer_reviews.text: BEST INSOLE I HAVE EVER USED. Been using for about 6 years now. I am on my feet all day every day averaging 50 - 70 hours weekly. Most comfortable and longest lasting I have used in the last 30 years. Love that they are CUT TO FIT. Like most boots, most insoles are sized way to narrow for my feet. These solve that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with timberland pro.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Nice cushion out of the package. I have low arches and I feel I could use some more support there than these seem they'll give during 12 hr work days but we will see! They do not seem like they will hold up for a longer than a few months. But hopefully I am wrong because they feel very nice under the foot and they do provide the extra comfort I am looking for my hard sole logger boots! They eliminated arch and heel pain for about 5 months before I started getting aches again. Ordered another pair and back in business!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing for my husband's workboots
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time purchasing inserts! Each time my husband buys a new pair he requests i order these for them. I have asked them why he doesn't just take the inserts out of the old boots and he says because he wants to use his old boots for working around the house and wants the inserts to stay in. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Edinger

customer_reviews.title: We're comfortable at first
customer_reviews.text: These are complete garbage. They lasted all of 3 days in my work boots. They were pretty comfortable at first but on day 3 both fell apart. They have since been thrown in the trash. Buy a better quality insole these cost too much to only last 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: cyrix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for factory worker
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who works in a factory on his feet all day. He had to cut them a little to fit but that is typical for shoe inserts so no problem there. He noticed a difference the very first time wearing them. He said his back pain was almost instantly relieved and after 2 nights it is all but gone. I will update later as to how long they last but for now we are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Keep the originals
customer_reviews.text: Was nice and supportive for the first few days, but after that I had to switch back to the regular ones. They feel really nice, but then acted more squishy and less supportive, and felt very uncomfortable. They also seemed to restrict air flow and my boots would get very moist, feeling like wet socks every day. Cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Walker

customer_reviews.title: great, worked, but overall, not for me
customer_reviews.text: Ok, these are great for a long work day on hard cement floors, BUT! they make your boots/shoes feel a lot bigger than they are, which crazy to get used to, i went back to my old inserts plus the originals that were in the new shoes, works great! my feet arent in the greatest shape after almost 30 years of beating on them, so this may not be the case for you, but overall i felt the arch support couldve been better as well, was lacking for me
customer_reviews.author: brian s

customer_reviews.title: Buy the size down if you're in between.
customer_reviews.text: These are very cushiony insoles, very much like memory foam so be aware of that when buying. Also, I bought a size 12-13 for my 11.5 wide shoe which was waaaay too big. The 10-11 size is what you would want if you're a size between with very minimal cutting. This goes for all shoe sizes that are a size between what is offered, be sure to get the size down b/c these insoles are very large.
customer_reviews.author: ZIPPY

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and support!
customer_reviews.text: Hiking boots need extra support and these are fantastic for that. I take out the insoles that come with my Timberland boots and I put these pro boot liners inside the boot instead. I have a lot of foot problems and these provide support and comfort, which allow me to spend hours and miles on my feet!
customer_reviews.author: tidyslipknot

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I became an electrician and was worried about having to stand/walk on concrete all day in steel toes. I found these inserts and decided to give them a try the day before I started and even with my plantar fasciitis in both heels it’s been great. I can go the entire day without my feet hurting. They were a little bigger than advertised but I was easily able to trim them to fit in my boots.
customer_reviews.author: BLynch

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, fairly thick insole
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for some redback boys but they were too thick. I ended up putting them in a pair of Jordan retro 1 high OGs, and they totally transformed the shoe. Jordan 1s have a super thin sole and are not super comfortable. These timberlands are pretty thick in the heel and transform the Jordans into super comfortable shoes I love to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these inserts about 4/5 months ago! WOW! they are worth every penny i use them in ..... yes my redwing boots for work(im a union steamfitter) the redwings inserts even the upgrades are awful. These inserts have changed how easy it is to work 8-15hrs a day with little to no fatigue on my feet. I highly recommend these i bought two more after the first week to have incase they stopped selling these. Thats how much i love them.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R

customer_reviews.title: Best replacement for Timerland Pro Rip Saw Boots...or any other for that matter!
customer_reviews.text: Since they are made to fit two sizes, they may be a tad bigger or a tad smaller for your particular boot size. Overall, these are the most comfortable soles on the market. The Timerland Pro Rip Saw boots I have will continue to be the boots I buy year after year. The boots have held up great but after a year and a half of almost every day use, the soles needed to be replaced. Trimmed these up to match the ones I was taking out and fit like a glove. Boots feel like brand new but with a broke in feeling. Can't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace the insoles on some Timberlands I've owned for a few years. I literally had walked holes in the old ones. These new insoles, once cut to size, were game changing. I hadn't realized how nice it was to live without foot pain. I'll be monitoring these to see how they wear down, but based on the quality of the Timberland products I've owned to date, I fully expect these to hold up.
customer_reviews.author: WanderingChef

customer_reviews.title: They are hands down the most comfortable insoles I've worn
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of inserts. The 1st came from a pair of Timberland work shoes that are no longer sold on Amazon. That was over 4yrs ago and I still have them--I just recycle them from shoe to shoe. These insoles work so well, they actually help redistribute pressure points in a way that your shoes last longer. They are hands down the most comfortable insoles I've worn. I even ordered two pairs to give to my coworkers and they love'em.
customer_reviews.author: Jmac

customer_reviews.title: Best inserts for workboots
customer_reviews.text: I love these inserts! I wear Timberland Pro boots at work and I put them through hell. The inserts that came with the boots were pretty worn down and after replacing with these my feet feel amazing. I work at Home Depot and the concrete floors do a number on my soles, I easily do 10,000-15,000 steps a night and these inserts have made a huge difference in being able to complete my shift without limping. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MeganJade

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull replacement insole!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these insoles, replace the ones in my year old timberland pit boss boots and they feel better then the first day I put them on. Besides the fact that they were worn in walking on concrete 10hrs a day these are better then the ones it came with originally. Spent $20 instead of having to spend $100 or more for new boots. Only complaint is it took 3 days instead of the guaranteed 2 day delivery for prime items.
customer_reviews.author: GDoubleU

customer_reviews.title: Not amazing, but not horrible. Just okay
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty large, and I wouldn't recommend these for high arch folks. They aren't soft or anything, but they aren't uncomfortable either. They definitely reduce impact and I can see these being better for hiking than being on your feet 8-16 hours... I also have Spenco Max and those are my choice over the two. I also feel like these Timberlands are overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Anti fatigue but I still came home from work tired.
customer_reviews.text: First the genius people who don’t understand u have to cut them because they are not one size fits all ignore their review. 2nd they are a bit thicker then the ones that come with my timberland pro boots, which is good however it will rise your feet a bit higher in the boot then u might be used to. And 3rd they say anti fatigue but I still came home from work tired. But my feet felt good
customer_reviews.author: Sgt M

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but liner came off after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on his feet all day long so needed a good insole for his boots. He came home after the first day he had them on and said that his feet hurt less than normal but that his socks felt funny. Once he got his boots off he realized that the liner of each insole had rolled up and that was what he was feeling. Now his sock stick to the insoles creating friction. He does has less fatigue, but the friction is unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: husband loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband for Christmas last year and they have held up well in his boots. Granted he doesn't wear the boots everyday but when he does he says they're so comfortable. He works in a warehouse and walks a lot so comfort is everything. He has one of those mats at his desk the black rubber anti-fatigue ones) and he said these insoles help him feel better than the mat ever has.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Buy now! Think later!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate. Buy them asap! You get your old inserts and place them on top of these to trace out how much to cut. Cut them out and be amazed. Im an oil field worker. 12 hour shifts and I've been using my inserts for 6 months and they still feel great. I change boot every 6 months due to the wear I put on them.
customer_reviews.author: Irod

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The first set that I received in 2018 seemed ok but the "anti-fatigue" only lasts a couple months. I work in a 300,000 sq-ft factory and cover several miles every day. The 2nd set ordered in August 2019 has fallen apart within the first week. I was hesitant to get anything from Timberland after a disappointing experience years ago but nothing has changed.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Frania

customer_reviews.title: Bad adhesive, having to return.
customer_reviews.text: Top layer separated within a couple of hours of wearing them leaving a rubbery texture that doesn't allow your foot to slide in or out without pulling insert. My first pair I bought a few years ago was great and held up very well. This batch seems to be made with bad adhesive. Return process is started. I have to ship these back to amazon for a refund. Not sure if I'll buy another pair from amazon. Probably pay extra and buy local.
customer_reviews.author: horton

customer_reviews.title: Good comfort. Needs to be more durable.
customer_reviews.text: I like these insoles but they could be better. In more than one way. I hadn't realized my boots came with these same insoles and I bought these thinking they were better. I purchased my boots in January and the insoles had holes in them by April. They are comfortable but could be better. Especially when wearing boots for 10 hours a day. And for the price I thought they would be better. Can't always trust the name. I like them but won't be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Postema Jr

customer_reviews.title: Save money buy Dr. Scholl's instead
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but you'll get the same comfort from Dr. Scholl's for a little cheaper. These lasted me 3 months which I expected them to, I work 12 hours a day on concrete in my amazing timberland shoes.The shoes though are amazing on concrete they will literally change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit as expected width wise.
customer_reviews.text: Fit NOT as expected. I have Redwing work boots, got these because of great reviews. One insole fits snug, the other one is a bit small and can feel it on the edge when walking around. You can feel the edge of the insole on the side of the foot, yes I did take it back out and see if I can reposition it but to luck.
customer_reviews.author: ThinkTank

customer_reviews.title: ... work boots on concrete floors and my feet feel like they are bruised by the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: I often wear work boots on concrete floors and my feet feel like they are bruised by the end of the day. I put these in my Thorogood boots and, while they don't feel soft like high-end ortho inserts, I can now wear the boots all day and my feet feel fine after hours on concrete. In other words, they took my foot comfort from quite bad to neutral. I still have some foot fatigue but no pain. For this price point, I'd say their performance is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McCulloch, Author of Fracture Gradient

customer_reviews.title: Too High In The Back and Low In The Toe Area
customer_reviews.text: Back is too high so it feels like your walking on your toes for 8 hours on a concrete floor. OUCH - Try SofSole Innersoles - after trying about 20 different brands the SofSole Blue with a Yellow Back are the best hands down. The Blue with Yellow back are for feet that have a normal arch not high or low.
customer_reviews.author: bird lady

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: Amaaaaaazing. I'm a little neurotic when it comes to researching products so I was able to find the one guy online who had tried out and reviewed a bunch of insoles and these impressed him as much as they impress me. So high quality that my partner wants to buy several more so that most of his shoes have these. Easy to cut to fit. Definitely not meant just for boots. You genuinely cant buy anything better than these unless they're custom made.
customer_reviews.author: Brea

customer_reviews.title: Reduce the extra space in your boot.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for insoles that would help a new pair of boots fit better. If you are in a search like I was to eliminate the extra room in your boot, this is the product for you. These insoles are thick enough if your boot feels a half size bigger. In my case, I removed the original insoles from my boots and replaced them with these Timberland PROs. These insoles are pretty firm, which had me wondering if they would be hurting my feet after hours of working. Which they did not. Overall, this product will help reduce they extra space in your boot and which is why I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan L.

customer_reviews.title: On my feet a lot
customer_reviews.text: So much better than what comes in the shoe new. I wear red wings and those soles are pretty rigid. Company choice not mine. These have helped my feet get through the day soo much,and im on my feet alot. Yet to be seen how long they last. Dont hesitate to buy them!!! They will not disappoint...
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: But whatever it works fine and doesn't really make a difference to the insole
customer_reviews.text: Have a pair of size 10 boots. I got the size 10 to 12 of these inserts. To get in the fit I had to almost cut well past the extra trimmable Edge. But whatever it works fine and doesn't really make a difference to the insole. I like these have been wearing them a few weeks and my feet at work have gone from making me miserable to hardly noticing. Will probably buy again. And also depends on what kind of feet you have I suppose. They are kind of thin at the front end but with my sci's boot it kind of works out because if they were thicker the steel toe would be pinching my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: they are thicker and even more comfortable than the originals
customer_reviews.text: I wore a hole in the original shoe's insole by the ball of my foot within 4 months but I walk at least 5 miles a day in them. I purchased these expecting an OEM/exact replacement for my shoes. These are not what comes with the shoe, they are thicker and even more comfortable than the originals! Keep in mind you will need to trim them to fit and they are much taller than original but will settle in/down in an hour or 2 of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ayers

customer_reviews.title: The Reviews Were Accurate - comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: Buying comfort inserts is always a big unknown since there are so many options available. I read a lot of reviews and decided to give these a try. I'm very pleased with them. I use them in a pair of Keen hiking boots. They are a good balance between gel and support. For me too much gel is not beneficial for long days wearing the boots. I am satisfied with these and will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: T. W.

product_meta.title: Timberland PRO Men's Anti-Fatigue Technology Replacement Insole
product_meta.description: Timberland set new industry standards for craftsmanship, durability and protection when it introduced an authentic, waterproof leather boot in 1973. A global leader in design, engineering and marketing of premium footwear, Timberland values consumers who cherish the outdoors and their time in it. Timberland has been an industry leader in the use of both sustainable and recycled materials in its shoes, as well as its footwear packaging. The Timberland Company believes in corporate responsibility and supports numerous civic and social projects throughout the year.
feature_bullets: KEEP IT COMFORTABLE: Timberland PRO insoles offer a carefully engineered upgrade in performance & comfort. The Anti-Fatigue Technology Insole features our exclusive inverted cone foam, designed to absorb shock & return energy to your feet with every step.

ANTI-FATIGUE TECHNOLOGY: A comfort system designed with shock-absorbing, geometrical technology that returns energy back to the foot to deliver all-day support & comfort. Stay comfortable on your feet all day with Timberland PRO's anti-fatigue technology.

A SOURCE OF PRIDE: We know you take pride in your work, so our soft-toed shoes and boots and steel-toe boots and shoes are designed to provide you with enhanced job performance day in and day out. Wear them at work well as at home with comfort & style.

QUALITY WORKWEAR: Timberland PRO assesses the unmet needs of those who work in the most demanding environments and then develops solutions that deliver ultimate comfort, durability & protection—all day long—from work boots & shoes to anti-fatigue insoles.

TIMBERLAND PRO: Compare the quality workmanship of Timberland PRO work boots & work shoes to products from Justin, Muck Boots, Servus, Tingley, Doc Martens, Romeos, Red Wing, Merrell, Ariat, Cat, Wolverine, Maelstrom, Stanley, Keen or Carhartt.
